techniques.name: Isolation Sparring Drills
techniques.description: Isolation sparring drills focus on enhancing specific aspects of a fighter's arsenal by limiting the tools available during sparring. This method encourages fighters to explore and refine all elements of their game, moving beyond reliance on their dominant techniques, such as a powerful rear hand. The drills progress from simple to complex, starting with jabs only and gradually incorporating more techniques.

types: Combination Free Spar with Limited Rear Hand

strategies.jab_mastery: Mastering the use of the jab in various forms including to the head, body, doubling, and tripling.
strategies.lead_teep_utilization: Employing the lead teep as a versatile tool for control, distance management, and setting up further attacks.
strategies.round_kick_integration: Incorporating lead round kicks to target different levels, enhancing the fighter's ability to attack fluidly from multiple angles.
strategies.comprehensive_lead_hand: Utilizing the lead hand for a full range of punches, fostering a well-rounded offensive strategy.
strategies.rear_leg_dynamics: Exploring the full potential of rear leg techniques without relying on the power rear hand punch, promoting a balanced skill set.

strategies.jab_defense: Developing defensive responses to the jab, including slipping, parrying, catching, and ducking, to handle the most common strike in combat sports.
strategies.anticipating_attacks: Learning to read and anticipate attacks based on limited offensive options, enhancing reaction times and defensive decision-making.

defensive.notes: The defensive component of isolation sparring drills is crucial for building a fighter's ability to adapt and react to various attacks with limited offensive cues.

variations.name: Jab Sparring
variations.description: Sparring using only the jab to attack, defend, and counter.

variations.name: Jab and Lead Teep Sparring
variations.description: Incorporating the jab and lead teep into sparring, focusing on these two techniques exclusively.

variations.name: Lead Techniques Sparring
variations.description: Expanding the arsenal to include all lead hand punches and lead leg kicks, but excluding the rear hand punch.

variations.name: Full Arsenal with Limited Rear Hand
variations.description: Free sparring with all weapons available, but with restricted use of the power rear hand, forcing creativity and versatility.
